page.title: 11EDUCATION 1
page.content: There is only one school in the survey area, Loddiswell Primary School. This school of just under 80 children takes children from rising 5's to 11yrs from most of the area. Primary age children from The Mounts attend East Allington School. Children of secondary age, from 11-18, travel by school bus to Kingsbridge Comprehensive School. Loddiswell Primary School has three classrooms, two in the main building, built in the middle of the 19th century, and the other in a wooden classroom erected 30 years ago. There is no school hall and meals are cooked on the premises and served in the classroom. The cost of a school meal in September 1985 is 60p. About 40 children have school meals, but many now bring packed lunches. Very few children go home at lunchtime.
